p: The morphology of coronaviruses varies from spherical to pleomorphic shape, with a diameter of 80–120 nm ( Masters, 2006). Coronaviruses possess the ability to form double membrane vesicles (DMVs) in the infected cells. They also exhibit recombination, high rates of mutation, and propensity to cross species. The coronavirus genome consists of 6–7 open reading frames (ORFs), as described below.
